H0.text: Tendons are tough connective tissues that attach skeletal muscles to the skeleton.

H1.text: Fibers are the tough connective tissues that attach skeletal muscles to the skeleton.

H2.text: Veins are tough connective tissues that attach skeletal muscles to the skeleton.

H3.text: Cords are tough connective tissues that attach skeletal muscles to the skeleton.

A4.text: A tendon or sinew is a tough band of dense fibrous connective tissue that connects muscle to bone.
